text: Hey all. I have a page made within HubSpot Pages. I am trying to load JQuery-UI but having a heck of a time doing it. How do I correctly do this and have it work with HubSpot?
Actually seem to be having trouble getting any JQuery to really load at all, frustratingly.
So I can run JQuery in the console with dev tools, but I can't actually get any jQuery to run that is programmed into the Head or Footer...
<@U0362589W23> do you really need jQuery? Everything in jQuery can be done with vanilla JS. <https://youmightnotneedjquery.com/>
Probably don't _need_ jQuery. Ultimately just trying to make a fixed pop up menu

i’m not a frontend guy, although I’ve done a fair amount of full stack development, but in my experience, jQuery isn’t worth loading in if you’re not using it heavily. I would try to figure out how to do what you’re doing just using JS.
Yeah i'm the same, I typically hate javascript anyways. I'll try to do what I want with vanilla js.
Hmmm, HubSpot seems to load javascript before any DOM content is filled out. Is there anyway to have it do the opposite?
Weird, I had to load it via a custom module.
